Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2013 11:38PM - edited Aug 21, 2013 12:34AM by lalenlou Three weeks ago, I had a bonescan which showed 2 new spots lighting up.  Both my oncologist and my radiology oncologist said that they could either be arthritis or new cancer.  It really had them puzzled why it would be cancer since I am still taking Arimedex pills daily and Herceptin/Perjeta chemo every 3 weeks.  I then had a PETscan.  The report from that showed "no metabolically active cancer" which means they are either just more arthritis or dead cancer cells.  Either way, I was estatic with the news!  My oncologist said these spots will always show up on a bonescan unless completely new bone is grown.
Posts.Title: Bone mets...I don't get it. raro DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 04:53AM lalenlou wrote: I was diagnosed in August, 2012 with Stage 4 BC.  I had a 4 1/2 cm tumor removed and 24 lymph nodes that showed 15 positive for cancer.  My T-8 vertebrae also had breast cancer. I still get Herceptin/Perjeta every 3 weeks with Zometa every 3 months. I just had a PETscan today because a bonescan I had a few weeks ago showed 2 more suspicious spots.  I am new to this site and you girls have no idea how comforting it is to me to realize there is still hope and life after getting a Stage 4 diagnosis.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2013 03:51PM lalenlou wrote: SaltyJack, I lost my hair 3 weeks after starting my Taxotere, Herceptin and Perjeta chemos. It was the Taxotere that did it to me. (Sorry to tell you this!) I am still getting Herceptin and Perjeta every 3 weeks and my hair is growing, so they don't cause it.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2013 11:51PM - edited Aug 21, 2013 01:38AM by lalenlou Eileenohio, I take 2 - 5000 mgs of Biotin a day. That is what was recommended to me by other BC girls.  I have always been a blonde (with help from my beautician!) and my hair is coming in super thick and DARK!!!  My hair is about 1 1/2" long, but I still wear my wig when I go outside my home.  My hairline is high and my hair is not yet long enough to cover it.  I just wish hair grew faster than 1/2" a month!  I bought a wig that looked exactly like my own hair did - in fact, most people are shocked when they find out it is a wig.  Both my family doctor and my radiologist thought it was my real hair and wondered out loud how I did not lose my hair during chemo!!  It was pretty funny!  When my grandkids spend the night with us, I try to get them used to me with my short hair.  My 4 year old grandson didn't say anything when he saw me at breakfast, but about an hour later, he walked into our living room with my wig, still didn't say anything, but he put the wig on my lap and walked away!!  My husband and I laughed out loud!!  I put the wig on and said, "Now do I look like Grandma?"
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2013 12:57AM lalenlou wrote: ForMyGranddaughter, once it started falling out, my hair was gone within 2 weeks.  Once it was gone, I could actually feel fuzz growing back by my 5th Taxotere treatment. (I had chemo every 3 weeks)  I kept most of my eyelashes until 1/2 way through, then I lost almost all of them.  They are starting to grow back, but VERY slowly.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2013 01:20AM - edited Sep 6, 2013 12:59AM by lalenlou Amanda, my oncologist told me my hair would start coming out 2 1/2 weeks after my first Taxotere treatment and she was exactly right!  I got my chemo treatments every 3 weeks and had to wear a turban-type scarf to my 2nd treatment.  I still had enough hair on top to comb forward (kind of like a "comb-over"!) and used the hair as bangs sticking out of my scarf.  It finally got so "mangy" looking that we took an electric razor and buzzed it down to about 1" long.  I never completely lost ALL of my hair, but about 95%.  It was a very sad time to be able to just pull clumps of hair out.  It was worse for me to lose my hair than my breast.  Our hair is so much apart of who we are as women, but know that it does grow back.  I bought a very nice wig for $300 that looked so close to my own hair that you could not tell it was a wig unless you knew what was going on with me.  It sure shortened my gettting ready time!  My hair is now about 1 1/2" long, very thick and very wavy.  I have been a blonde all my life and now my hair is a deep dark brown!!!  I am still wearing my wig outside of the house because as my granddaughter said, "Grandma, you look like a man!" Keep the faith!  You will get through this!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2014 09:08PM lalenlou wrote: I knew I had BC in my T8 vertebrae before my mastectomy.  Radiation and chemo "killed" it.  I found out today after a bone scan that it is back and now, also, in my T6 vertebrae and both of my 9th ribs.  My oncologist said That I will continue getting my Herceptin and Perjeta chemo every 3 weeks and Zometa every 3 months.  She is changing my anti-estrogen med from Arimidex to Faslodex.  Anyone else on Faslodex?
